original_title: Sri Lanka bond yields open higher, rupee at 319.50/320.00 to dollar
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s bond yields opened marginally higher Tuesday with investors focusing on a bill auction, being held a day earlier in a traditional New Year holiday week, dealers said.
The rupee was quoted at 319.50/320.00 to the US dollar busines done around 320 to the US dollar dealers said. The rupee closed at 319/320 rupees against the US dollar.

The rupee tends to strengthen in April as extra remittances come in as expatriate workers send money to their families and exporters convert dollars to pay workers salaries early allowing the central bank to collect dollars.

However in some years, including in 2018 when the central bank started aggressive open market operations from around February and cut rates in April injecting large volumes of money under ‘data driven flexible inflation targeting, the rupee has come under pressure in the month as credit recovered.
In bond markets at bond maturing on 01.07.2025 was quoted at 27.30/60 percent up from Monday’s close of 27.10/30 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 was quoted at 25.70/80 up from  25.40/60 percnet. (Colombo/April11/2023)
